documentation.text: @dev the maximum amount of CNC that can be minted for rebalancing rewards
@dev gives out 5 dollars per 1 hour (assuming 1 CNC = 6 USD) for every 10,000 USD in TVL that needs to be shifted

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "only InflationManager can call this function"

arguments.value: only InflationManager can call this function

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "only InflationManager can call this function"

documentation.text:
NOTE: we do not use the `emergencyMinter` anymore so we pass in address(0) as the emergency minter
 to disable the usage of `renounceMinterRights`
 From V3, we can remove the dependency on `BaseMinter` altogether but for now we need it
 to be able to call `EmergencyMinter.switchRebalancingRewardsHandler`

@dev this computes how much CNC a user should get when depositing
 this does not check whether the rewards should still be distributed
 amount CNC = t * CNC/s * (1 - (Δdeviation / initialDeviation))
 where
 CNC/s: the amount of CNC per second to distributed for rebalancing
 t: the time elapsed since the weight update
 Δdeviation: the deviation difference caused by this deposit
 initialDeviation: the deviation after updating weights
 @return the amount of CNC to give to the user as reward

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "handler is still registered for a pool"

arguments.value: handler is still registered for a pool

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "handler is still registered for a pool"

documentation.text:
@notice switches the minting rebalancing reward handler by granting the new one minting rights
 and renouncing his own
 `InflationManager.removePoolRebalancingRewardHandler` should be called on every pool before this is called
 this should typically be done as a single batched governance action
 The same governance action should also call `InflationManager.addPoolRebalancingRewardHandler` for each pool
 passing in `newRebalancingRewardsHandler` so that the whole operation is atomic
 @param newRebalancingRewardsHandler the address of the new rebalancing rewards handler

computeRebalancingRewards(address,uint25.details: this computes how much CNC a user should get when depositing this does not check whether the rewards should still be distributed amount CNC = t * CNC/s * (1 - (Δdeviation / initialDeviation)) where CNC/s: the amount of CNC per second to distributed for rebalancing t: the time elapsed since the weight update Δdeviation: the deviation difference caused by this deposit initialDeviation: the deviation after updating weights

returns._0: the amount of CNC to give to the user as reward

constructor.notice: NOTE: we do not use the `emergencyMinter` anymore so we pass in address(0) as the emergency minter to disable the usage of `renounceMinterRights` From V3, we can remove the dependency on `BaseMinter` altogether but for now we need it to be able to call `EmergencyMinter.switchRebalancingRewardsHandler`

handleRebalancingRewards(address,address.notice: Handles the rewards distribution for the rebalancing of the pool

params.account: The account that is rebalancing the pool
params.conicPool: The pool that is being rebalanced
params.deviationAfter: The total absolute deviation of the Conic pool after the rebalancing
params.deviationBefore: The total absolute deviation of the Conic pool before the rebalancing

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

switchMintingRebalancingRewardsHandler(a.notice: switches the minting rebalancing reward handler by granting the new one minting rights and renouncing his own `InflationManager.removePoolRebalancingRewardHandler` should be called on every pool before this is called this should typically be done as a single batched governance action The same governance action should also call `InflationManager.addPoolRebalancingRewardHandler` for each pool passing in `newRebalancingRewardsHandler` so that the whole operation is atomic

params.newRebalancingRewardsHandler: the address of the new rebalancing rewards handler

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

_INITIAL_REBALANCING_REWARD_PER_DOLLAR_P.details: gives out 5 dollars per 1 hour (assuming 1 CNC = 6 USD) for every 10,000 USD in TVL that needs to be shifted

_MAX_REBALANCING_REWARDS.details: the maximum amount of CNC that can be minted for rebalancing rewards
